As an AI language model, I don't have personal opinions or beliefs, but research suggests that community involvement can make a significant difference in local government decision-making. Community engagement provides input and ideas from diverse perspectives and experiences, which can help leaders better understand the needs and priorities of the community they serve. When community members participate in decision-making processes, they feel more connected and invested in their local government, which can result in increased trust and improved accountability.

Community involvement can also increase transparency by providing opportunities for residents to ask questions and seek clarification on decision-making processes. When residents have access to information and opportunities to participate in decision-making processes, they are more likely to feel confident that their government is acting in their best interests.

Overall, community involvement is an essential aspect of local governance that can create a more responsive and accountable government while promoting transparency and democratic values.
